item.title: MacIver: Military Voters in Wisconsin Told to Submit Ballots a Week After Deadline

item.content:encoded: MacIver: Military Voters in Wisconsin Told to Submit Ballots a Week After Deadline http://t.co/tJey4AUH via @BreitbartNews @MacIverWisc The Federal Voting Assistance Program website published an incorrect deadline for the return of returning military ballots in Wisconsin. Had this error not been corrected, thousands of Wisconsin servicemen and women could have been disenfranchised in this key swing state this November. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Devs, BlackBerry Is Going To Keep On Loving You
item.description: @JoannaStern Here's the link to it on YouTube - http://t.co/kZdCvoZb
item.content:encoded: @JoannaStern Here's the link to it on YouTube - http://t.co/kZdCvoZb This video is a thank you to all developers supporting the BlackBerry platform. Your Developer Relations, Alliance and Developer Tools teams appreciate your enthusiasm and loyalty! We're Going To Keep On Loving You. Shown at BlackBerry Jam Americas Sept 2012. We are going to keep loving developers at Research In Motion, all the way to BlackBerry 10 and beyond. Watch our leadership team for developer relations bring back the band: Alec Saunders, VP Developer Relations & Ecosystem, Chris Smith, VP Application Platform & Tools, and Martyn Mallick, VP Global Alliances & Business. Thank you to those devs who are working hard, and for those jumping on board every day. Stay updated at http://developer.blackberry.com and http://devblog.blackberry.com. Let's Rock and Roll This! Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: youtube.com

item.content:encoded: Islamophobic New York Subway Ads Labeled ‘Hate Speech’ And ‘Racist’ http://t.co/vfC6k18P After the anti-American protests erupted in the Middle East earlier this month, Pam Geller’s American Freedom Defense Initiative (AFDI) decided to re-up its anti-Muslim ad campaign in New York’s subway system. item.title: CNN: Obama looked a little foolish by appearing on The View, huh? - Hot Air
item.description: CNN: Obama looked a little foolish by appearing on The View, huh? http://t.co/Dw7C8MeG #Mitt2012 #tcot
item.content:encoded: CNN: Obama looked a little foolish by appearing on The View, huh? http://t.co/Dw7C8MeG #Mitt2012 #tcot No kidding. While Egypt seems as unclear as Barack Obama on the status of our relationship, the President wasn’t in New York working out those issues with Mohamed Morsi or other world leaders. Instead, he was hashing out his own problems with the hosts of The View on ABC, which CNN found “just a little … weird.” In fact, the conclusion was that Obama made himself look foolish by abandoning his duties and having Hillary Clinton fill in for him instead: Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: hotair.com

item.title: Are we too sensitive to partisan skew in polls? - Hot Air
item.description: Are we too sensitive to partisan skew in polls? http://t.co/08NjU1KS #Mitt2012 #tcot
item.content:encoded: Are we too sensitive to partisan skew in polls? http://t.co/08NjU1KS #Mitt2012 #tcot Critics of media polling have long complained about the sample skew that tends to favor Democrats in their surveys. We do a lot of poll analysis here at Hot Air and we routinely compare the modeling to exit polling in past elections. National Journal reports today that pollsters, especially those who work with media outlets, have begun to fight back against the criticism leveled by conservatives of institutional sample skew, claiming that they’re seeing trends on the ground that previous electoral models won’t capture: Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: hotair.com

item.title: The Story Of An Internet Troll With A Surprising Twist | TechCrunch
item.description: The Story Of An Internet Troll With A Surprising Twist http://t.co/xz5Hmkzz by @johnbiggs
item.content:encoded: The Story Of An Internet Troll With A Surprising Twist http://t.co/xz5Hmkzz by @johnbiggs You get a thick skin when messing around on the Internet, and that can go either way. You can react, like a nerve burned raw, or you can become a troll. This is a story of both. I'll paraphrase the story here, but go and read it yourself. It's quite short and very concise. It shows a man's descent into fear and his eventual recovery and uncovers part of the Internet that, in a word, horrifies me. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: 25 Things You Should Do Before Starting Your Next Novel
item.description: 25 Things You Should Do Before Starting Your Next Novel vía @terribleminds http://t.co/ZGWxHMC7
item.content:encoded: 25 Things You Should Do Before Starting Your Next Novel vía @terribleminds http://t.co/ZGWxHMC7 * I’m about to tackle a new novel (The Blue Blazes, coming in something-something 2013!), and also, I see the green flash on the horizon that indicates the coming reality storm that is “National Novel Writing Month,” so this seems like a good time for a post like this one, yeah? Do you actually need to do all these things? No, of course not. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: terribleminds.com

item.title: Valerie Jarrett: The Next Van Jones
item.description: http://t.co/dqB4AOs0 http://t.co/LORO3Ap7
item.content:encoded: http://t.co/dqB4AOs0 http://t.co/LORO3Ap7 We stated that we would show a lot more of what our President Obama is and his history with his fellow associates. We must remember that it was Obama himself whom stated, “People are known for the company they keep.” Now given this idea of Obama him self let us begin to dissect his “associates’ or his group of people that he has surrounded himself with. Let us begin first with his closest advisor. Most people should know the lady. She had more security around her than our ambassador to Libya! Her name, Valerie Jarrett. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: freedomoutpost.com
